inventory.commentary: Note: idiom 'on paper' means 'in writing' 12Jun08 - added sense, and example. ahouston

sense.name: manufactured wood pulp product
sense.commentary: PAPER[+entity][+artifact][+material][+manufactured][+from_pulp][+wood] Note: usually manufactured in sheets or rolls
sense.examples: The copy machine is out of paper. Take a piece of paper and write down your name and address. She wrapped the gifts in blue paper. I can't decide which paper would look best on my dining room walls. There is a big plant near Savannah that makes paper.

sense.name: loose-paged periodical of newsprint, usually daily
sense.commentary: PAPER[+entity][+artifact][+document][+periodical][+news][+loose_leafed] Note: news periodicals that are loose_leafed, short for 'newspaper'
sense.examples: He has tried to keep his name out of the papers. There was an interesting editorial yesterday in the paper. We subscribe to three papers and six magazines. John always had his nose stuck in the paper at breakfast. Use today's paper as packing material for that box of glasses.

sense.name: composition, essay or article of a scholastic nature
sense.examples: My son had to write a paper about the Titanic for his history class. Philip made some suggestions on the second draft of my paper. Lisa Randall published two highly influential papers on extra dimensions.

sense.name: an enterprise or company that publishes newsprint
sense.examples: He started working for the local paper when he was only sixteen. The workers at both papers are on strike this week. A New York holding company has purchased several major city papers this year.

sense.name: legal documents, often with required signatures
sense.examples: I authorized my lawyer to sign the papers at the house closing. He stuffed the legal papers into his briefcase. They were deported because they didn't have any papers.

sense.name: negotiable notes of commerce
sense.commentary: PAPER[+entity][+artifact][+document][+commercial][+negotiable] Note: a special form of money
sense.examples: The commercial paper issued by that bank is not negotiable in this country. The briefcase contained fifty thousand, twenty of it in commercial paper.

sense.name: in writing
sense.examples: This design looks solid, at least on paper. On paper these stocks are worth about ten million. His profits on paper look good at the moment, but he hasn't sold anything to realize gains.

sense.name: manufacturer of paper as a bulk commodity
sense.commentary: PAPER[+entity][+organization][+enterprise][+manufacturer][+of_commodity][+bulk] Note: this refers to producers of paper products, not newspaper companies.
sense.examples: These lobbyists represent paper and lumber interests. When paper moved out of the region, several thousand workers lost their jobs. The German paper company was bought by an international conglomerate.
